meanings.definition: To make or become younger in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She started youthening her skin by using a new moisturizer every day.
meanings.sent2: The magical potion had the power of youthening anyone who drank it.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the fountain of youth was actually a youthening spray.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to youthen the whole world, bringing a fresh start to the day.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to youthen the old portrait, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: The act of rejuvenating or revitalizing.
meanings.sent1: Her daily yoga routine was her secret youthening practice.
meanings.sent2: The spa offered a special treatment for complete youthening of the body and mind.
meanings.sent3: The youthening of the town's park brought new life to the community.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was a youthening experience, energizing everyone who attended.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children in the playground was a natural youthening for the soul.
